thread.title: Thunder unable to dig out of early hole
thread.title_full: Thunder unable to dig out of early hole

author: HERALD STAFF REPORT
title: Thunder unable to dig out of early hole
text:
Thunder unable to dig out of early hole HERALD STAFF REPORT The Clinton Herald 
GALENA, Ill. — Galena clinched a playoff berth and denied West Carroll from ensuring itself a spot in the postseason with a 49-28 victory in Northwest Upstate Illini Conference football. 
Bruce Scharpf rushed for 147 yards and scored three touchdowns for the Pirates, who improved to 6-2, 5-2 in the Northwest Division. Illinois teams are guaranteed a postseason bid when they reach the six-win mark. The loss kept the Thunder one win away from that plateau. 
Galena, tied with conference rival Forreston for 10th place in the Illinois Class 1A AP poll, jumped to a 20-0 lead, with Scharpf scoring the second touchdown on a 3-yard run, then adding a 2-yard scoring run with 6 minutes, 49 seconds left in the second quarter. 
Ethan Mangler, who rushed for 99 yards and two TDs for the Thunder (5-3, 4-3), put them on the scoreboard when he scored on a 5-yard run with 1:14 left in the half. 
West Carroll never got any closer, though. 
Mangler broke off a 73-yard run to pull West Carroll within 27-12 with 3:06 left in the third quarter, only to see Galena's Caleb Flack return the kickoff 85 yards for a score. 
West Carroll closes the season next Friday against Lena-Winslow, the No. 1-ranked team in Class 1A. A win would put the Thunder in the playoffs, but if they lose they would need enough points (opponents' wins) to get in with five wins. 
GALENA 49, WEST CARROLL 28 
West Carroll 0 6 6 16 — 28 
Galena 14 6 15 14 — 29 
G — Ethan Sasek (Adrian Jimenez kick), 5:51 
G — Bruce Scharpf 3 run (Jimenez kick), 1:40 
G — Scharpf 2 run (PAT failed), 6:49
